phrases: Nana!
Shoji!
Hold... me!
What is with that face?
I am sorry about earlier.
I said stuff I should not have.
Do not worry about it.
That killed the mood!
When I was darkness at that time
With trembling lips
The more I struggle
The more this wound deepens
The broken promise hurt me
Nobody can save me
God, I have only one request
Stop tearing apart my love
I need your love
I am a broken rose
Sorrow tumbling down is your song
All alone with nowhere to go in my life
I need your love
I am a broken rose
Oh baby, help me from frozen pain
With your smile, your eyes, and sing me, just for me
I want to need your love
I am a broken rose
I want to need your love
Jun-chan, you have got to hear this.
You know what Shoji!
Good night.
Room 707?
Give me a break!
What are you talking to yourself for?
That is scary.
I am not talking to myself.
I am talking to Demon Lord.
That is even scarier!
Damn, I am tired from running around.
You really are troublesome.
It is your fault for leaving me all alone!
Why, at a time like this, must I speak like a bitch?
I want to always be the cute girl when with the man I like.
I cannot stand this.
Perhaps it is too late now.
I have shown Shoji things about me that are less attractive,
and here we are in a room together and there is no longer that sense of nervousness.
He is just gone right off to sleep.
You know, Nana...
The truth is, I really want to bring you to Tokyo with me.
But, you know, I do not have a job.
I am not even a University student, just studying to enter one.
If you were on the verge of life and death,
I could do nothing to help you.
That is hard for a man.
I want you to understand that.
Then...
Then I will stay back home,
find a job and save up money to come to Tokyo!
Then, after one year, you pass the University entrance exam,
I will come to Tokyo too.
Then I will find a job here and work hard so that I can make it on my own!
Would it be okay then?
Then I must pass next year, no matter what.
Just watch me, Demon Lord!
All right!
Now that we have made up, why do not we sleep together for a change?
What do you mean by that?!
For a change suggests we have done this in the past!
We have not even kissed yet!
It is okay if you do not want to.
I have become used to holding back.
Does not it cross his mind that it might be nice to build the mood?
Never mind.
Do not jump to conclusions on your own!
Oh?
Then why do not you share your opinion on this subject?
Huh?
Well...
Then, if you tell me that you love me,
I will sleep with you.
Love?
You have got to realize this is not about who says what!
You cannot expect a Japanese man to say that!
But I have never had anyone say those words to me in my life.
I would be happy to hear it just once.
What is the point if it is said because you asked?
Never mind.
All right, you win.
A man's got to do what a man's got to do.
I will say it.
I will just think of myself as an American.
My name's Michael.
Who is that?
Do I hafta sleep with some mysterious foreigner?
I will not sleep with anyone but Shoji.
I am going to make some tea, okay?
So would you prefer green tea or brown tea, Michael?
Nana.
Shoji, I know you said it...
inside your heart.
You told me that you love me.
So you heard it.
I wanted to have a happy love.
Romantic and dramatic like in the movies.
But during the summer of seventeen, I became a woman
and learned that dating men is not so sweet like on the big screen.
Or so I thought.
But that evening, my body was melting away
with the sweet taste of happiness.
I wonder if things are all right between those two.
I am a bit worried.
But they cannot rely on their friends to bring them back together.
They are not junior high school kids.
Right?
Do not just leave me here talking to myself.
Good night.
A woman's life is not so bad after all, is it, Jun-chan?
But it is long distance.
Huh?
Nothing.
That will be three hundred yen for the late return.
Ah, right.
Nana.
Want To have dinner with me tonight?
Mr. Nakamura.
That would be a problem.
You may have finally woken up to my beauty,
but it is too late now, Nakamura.
What is the big deal?
It is just dinner.
And he is not serious.
Are not you lonely with your boyfriend having moved to Tokyo?
And he is a pest.
But you had a crush on me.
You have got the wrong person!
Should I quit that job?
But it pays pretty good.
I hafta hurry and save money, so that I can move to Tokyo.
I cannot wait until next spring!
Yes, this is Nana!
Shoji!
I am doing great!
Nana Komatsu.
I am 19 years old.
I have a boyfriend, but we are in a long-distance relationship.
I will show you, Demon Lord!
I do not know where I was born.
I have never seen my father,
and I have long forgotten what my mother looks like.
I came to this coastal city when I was four,
where I was raised by my grandmother who owns a little restaurant.
She had nothing but sarcastic remarks for me.
Right now, I work long hours while polishing the shards of my dream.
Good evening!
We are Blast.
Thank you!
It is cold!
It is too cold!
They are coming!
No way!
Everyone was waiting out here in this freezing cold?
Thanks a lot for today.
Nana!
Your performance was the best!
Thank you.
Nana!
I have a present for you.
What is it?
Vivienne Westwood?
You sure it is okay, Misato?
You...
You remembered my name?
Of course, because you are always there when we are performing live.
Nana, your birthday was last week, right?
That is a birthday present for you!
Happy eighteenth birthday!
Thank you.
Yay!
I got Vivienne Westwood!
Izakaya - Japanese pub
Izakaya - Japanese pub
Okay then, here is to today's successful show.
- Cheers! - Cheers!
We were by far the best in tonight's battle of the bands, right?
Most of the audience came to see us.
I never imagined such a day would come
when I would be so popular with women.
But they all come dressed as Nana.
It is kind of scary, if you ask me.
Wow, it is a jacket.
I am touched!
I will bet the other fans are strangling that girl about now.
A significant investment for one kiss from me.
Demon!
Excuse me, I will have another!
Nobu, stop it already.
Your graduation is tomorrow, right?
Are not you attending graduation, Nana?
Well, excuse me for dropping out of high school!
What is up with that?
I only finished junior high.
Why are you bragging about it?!
The national university student's laughing.
Rub it in, will you?
Still I would have liked to see Nana in her school uniform.
Did you wear those loose socks, too?
Do not go there, Yassan.
She was one terrifying girl in school.
I was so scared I would not dare talk to her.
Liar!
You were always following me around!
You were really annoying!
What is that?
I became your friend
because you were always alone at school and looked lonely!
You should thank me for that!
Hurray for Blast!
It is no use.
Let us just leave him and go home.
You think he will die?
Yeah, he will die.
I will flag down a taxi and take him home.
Yassan, you sure have money.
You are not learning law for nothing, you lawyer-to-be.
Yasu, should Nana get thrown in jail,
make sure and defend her as her lawyer.
What do you take me for?!
I will never get caught.
- Did you do something wrong?
- Wait, Ren.
I will tell Nobu about that thing.
So you tell Nana, okay?
About what?
The truth is,
the reason
Yasu became a skinhead has to do with this bald spot he got.
In the end, those who laugh at the bald, cry as a bald!
Performing live is the best.
How can I put it... Orgasmic!
I come while on stage.
There is no stopping it.
I am glad for you.
Yup.
It is awesome.
It feels sooo good.
Even better than doing it with a man?
That depends on the man.
Wow, I am freezing!
I will catch a cold!
What would you do if I end up losing my precious voice?
Is not there a hand warmer or something?
Those girls need a lesson on gift buying.
There has to be something we can use, like a scarf or something.
Found one!
- Awesome! - Awesome!
Ren Honjo Nana Osaki
Hey, Ren, do you remember?
There was a snowstorm the first time we met as well.
I remember.
Really?
It was at a Christmas live concert a few years ago.
Two years and three months ago.
You were wearing a red dress that day.
Was I?
You do not even hafta remember the clothes I wore.
I could not forget it even if I wanted to.
You were the worst audience ever, for refusing to get into the mood.
What are you saying?!
You were in the very front
and just stood there with a cold look on your face.
I was thinking, What is up with her?
It pissed me off.
Then, after the show, you came backstage with Nobu.
The way you greeted me was pitiful.
All you said was, I am Nana.
Without even so much as a smile.
That was it.
Do not you have anything else to say?
Back then, there was so much going on, I was in a bad state.
Yeah.
Because you got kicked outta school for selling yourself.
I was not!
I was framed!
You are the one who took my virginity!
Sorry about that.
Calm down.
But given your short temper,
I am surprised that you did not fight back.
I did not have the energy to lose my temper back then.
Yeah.
That certainly was the expression you had.
Besides, I wanted to quit school and get a job,
so I figured it worked out well.
But was not your nasty grandmother overworking you at the store?
What did you need the extra money for, to put up with that?
I wanted money.
And Grandma never gave me even a penny of allowance money.
It is not a laughing matter!
Yeah, yeah.
I told you before.
When I was four, my mother left me with Grandma and disappeared.
She gave birth to me without knowing who my father was.
Soon enough, I became a burden to her so she fled with another man.
Grandma had a habit of telling me
how she did not want me growing up to be like my mother.
Therefore, I was never allowed to wear pink or red girlish clothes.
She said they were provocative colors that would seduce men.
When Grandma died, I was all alone.
I decided I would use the money I earned to buy poor me a Christmas present.
Of all things, I bought myself a frilly red dress.
I excitedly wore it to the live concert that evening.
I was hiding the red dress under my coat and ran in the snowstorm.
He is my senior at school, two years older than me!
He is really cool!
I will introduce you to him later.
Really, do not bother.
I just came to have fun.
You will see what I am talking about when you meet and talk to him.
He is more level-headed than your average grownup.
He grew up in an orphanage, so I am sure he is gone through hard times.
Ren was abandoned in the warehouse district by the harbor,
right after he was born.
It was apparently all over the news.
Nobuo, it is not nice to talk about such touchy issues of someone else.
It is all right.
Ren boasts about it.
He does?
He brags that not too many people can say
they were in the news right after they were born.
On top of that, he actually lives in that warehouse district.
He says,
This is my origin.
Ren is trying to become a professional musician.
So he says he is thankful for his scandalous past
because it attracts attention!
What is that all about?
What a fool.
Why?
That is pretty cool!
He is just trying to get sympathy by selling his unfortunate past.
That is so not cool.
But I was charmed by the man who appeared on stage.
Ren was abandoned in the warehouse district by the harbor.
Ren boasts about it.
What name do I give that feeling that was born that night?
Sweet words like love or adore just do not sound right.
Perhaps envy and irritation mixed in with jealousy.
And moreover desire.
Even now I get anxious.
Because sometimes I feel that this daily life,
living together with Ren, is nothing but a dream.
Ren was a bright light that lightened the boring life I lived until then.
But no matter how hard I try, he still remains outta my reach.
I wish we could do it in a bigger place.
You are right.
This place is kind of small.
Not that.
I mean performing on stage.
We have the fan base now.
Yeah, go for it.
I mean both of us.
By the way,
what was that thing Yasu was talking about as we were leaving.
He seemed kind of serious.
Was it concerning the band?
Getting a bald spot is a serious matter.
Never mind.
I will hear about it from Yasu.
More importantly, I would better take my medicine.
Cannot live without it, huh?
Junkie!
No way!
It is the pill!
We would be in trouble if I do not take it!
Since you will not do anything for prevention!
What are we going to do if I have a baby?!
Give birth, and we will raise it.
I worked hard labor instead of going to high school,
so I have got lots of money.
One or two kids would be totally fine.
Fine with you, but not with me.
Right now I would rather perform than raise kids.
Nana...
I am going to Tokyo.
You live your life however you like.
I reached into the sky
But I could not reach what I wanted
They grew smaller and disappeared into the sky
Like colorful balloons
I am alone
My hand had no place to go
And gently you took it
Starless night
I will not look back at the shadow of my past
I want to feel your warmth
Tears are falling down
Even if I am unsure I will not let go
